text: Any idea on how to convert a date into timestamps? Variable to be converted {{ eastern_dt }}. Thanks
<@U3UJ5GUNT> does it need to stay in HubL, or could you pass the variable and reformat in JS? Just a thought.
It needs to stay in HubL. The purpose is to pass the value in a query for HubDB table to retrieve upcoming events . Events date > = today
I managed to do it by getting all the table rows and comparing the dates  year , month & day but this is not clean coding and not good for a big table
There isnâ€™t a function yet that does the inverse of `datetimeformat`. Is it possible to get the input as a timestamp?

yeah unfortunately there isn't an inverse of datetimeformat. The input needs to be "The current date"  Today. There are two variables that provides this: {{eastern_dt}} and {{ local_dt }} but not as a timestamp.
I believe if you do `{{ local_dt | int }}`  you will get the timestamp value
